intro: [WRONG START] Obernna reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a slender stem with a few leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from the forest floor. Oberna reticulata is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests.
